summary: The TypeScript SDK client connection does not send client-name and client-version HTTP headers, unlike the worker connection. This header information is needed for proper client identification and tracking.
userImpact: Users cannot be properly identified and tracked through HTTP headers when using the TypeScript SDK client, limiting observability and debugging capabilities.
rootCause: The client connection implementation is missing the code that sends client-name and client-version headers, which is already implemented in the worker connection.
resolutionDetails: The headers were added to the client connection to match the worker connection implementation.
keyQuote: Only the worker connection does, needs to be applied to the client connection too.
